definition: not take a proper measure of oneself/to overrate one's own abilities
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: I have a back overconfident , but also to do a study of these studies .
sentences.chinese: 我也不自量力一回，也对这些研究做一番研究。

sentences.english: He overreached himself in trying to get the manager's job.
sentences.chinese: 他不自量力想谋求经理职位，但没成功。

sentences.english: A mountain rivers for their discontent worth beefing up, give him Too Big for Her Skin.
sentences.chinese: 百川不满一山为自己催谷身价，大骂他不自量力。

sentences.english: Any users of credit may overextend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 每个贷款使用者都有可能作出不自量力的事。

sentences.english: He Yun remind clock from, no matter with whom to begin, dont overreach.
sentences.chinese: 何芸提醒钟离，不管跟谁要动手，别不自量力。

definition: lit. an ant trying to shake a big tree (idiom)/fig. to overrate one's own strength/also written 蚍蜉撼樹|蚍蜉撼树[pi2 fu2 han4 shu4]
lit. an ant trying to shake a tree/to overrate oneself (idiom)
a mantis trying to stop a chariot (idiom)/to overrate oneself and attempt sth impossible/also written 螳臂擋車|螳臂挡车[tang2 bi4 dang3 che1]
lit. an ant trying to shake a tree/to overrate oneself (idiom)
to be ridiculous/to make a fool of oneself
